alert.note: Alert for Durham; Franklin; Granville (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 1:19PM EST until January 04 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance, Chatham, Durham, Franklin, Granville, Orange, Vance and Wake. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 113 PM EST, heavy rain has come to an end, but flooding was still present due to 2 to 4 inches of rain that fell earlier today. - This includes numerous streams and drainages, including Crabtree Creek in the vicinity of Old Wake Forest, among other basins in the Triangle area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Hillsborough, Creedmoor, Pittsboro, Wake Forest, Carrboro, Butner, Kittrell, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Stem, Bethesda, Parkwood, Research Triangle and Gorman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
